questions.question: When two vehicles from different directions arrive at the same time at a four-way stop, which should have the right-of-way?
choices: The vehicle that is bigger
The vehicle approaching from the right
The vehicle that is traveling faster

questions.question: Unless posted otherwise, which is the speed limit in mobile home parks?
choices: 35 mph
15 mph
20 mph

questions.question: Yellow or amber flashing lights near the top of a school bus mean:
choices: The bus is loading or unloading children
The bus is about to stop
The bus is about to resume motion

questions.question: You may always continue carefully against a steady yellow arrow when:
choices: You are already within the intersection
You are turning right
You are turning left into a one-way street

questions.question: Why should you stay out of a trucker's no-zones?
choices: These zones create strong air flow and draft
The trucker need this space to accelerate
They are the trucker's blind spots

questions.question: If there is an oncoming vehicle in your lane, you should:
choices: Brake and go to the right of the oncoming vehicle
Make an emergency stop in your lane, and back up, if necessary
Brake and steer to your left

questions.question: Points placed on your driving record remain for:
choices: One year
Two years
Six months

questions.question: Know signs by their shapes. What is the upside-down triangle used for?
choices: Railroad advance warning signs
Yield signs
Stop signs

questions.question: What parts of a road might hold frost and ice while the rest is dry?
choices: Intersections
Bridges
Curvy roads

questions.question: When you hear an emergency vehicle approaching from any direction on an undivided highway, you must:
choices: Continue driving in your lane at the same speed
Slow down
Pull to the right side of the road and stop

questions.question: On a sharp curve, you should use your brakes to slow your vehicle:
choices: Before entering the curve
Just after entering the curve
During the entire time you drive through the curve

questions.question: A lane with this pavement marking may be used by:
choices: Motorists only
Both bicyclist and motorists
Bicyclists only

questions.question: If red lights are flashing and gates are closing at a railroad crossing, you must:
choices: Stop and remain stopped until gates open and lights stop flashing
Stop and wait until the gates close, then drive carefully around the gates
Speed up and pass the crossing before the gates close

questions.question: You approach this intersection. Which lane must you use for a left turn?
choices: Right-hand lane (C)
Middle lane (B)
Left-hand lane (A)

questions.question: Leaving a sleeping baby inside a car on a hot day is:
choices: Reasonable if you leave the car for less than 30 minutes
Illegal
Reasonable if the baby is less than six months old

questions.question: Shifting to a lower gear when going down a steep hill:
choices: Often cause you to lose control of your vehicle
Helps control speed and protect your brakes from damage
Can cause your brakes to overheat

questions.question: When you enter city traffic from a full stop (pulling away from the curb), you should:
choices: Make sure you have a large enough gap to get up to the speed of traffic
Not use your turn signal, it might confuse other drivers
Always enter your lane slower than traffic flow

questions.question: You should look carefully for bicyclists in traffic, especially when:
choices: Entering freeways
Proceeding straight through an intersection with a green light
Turning or opening a car door

questions.question: This type of sign shows:
choices: Recommended safe speeds on a highway
Minimum speeds to use on freeways
Maximum speeds allowed on a freeway

questions.question: You should leave more space on slippery roads in front of your vehicle. This extra space is needed:
choices: For you to stop safely
For other drivers when merging or changing lanes
For other drivers to slow down after passing

questions.question: A flashing red traffic signal at an intersection has the same meaning as:
choices: A yield sign
A slow sign
A stop sign

questions.question: If the rear of your vehicle starts to skid left, you should:
choices: Steer left
Keep the steering wheel straight
Hit your brakes

questions.question: Daily deer activity is highest:
choices: At dawn and dusk
In the middle of the day
Late at night

questions.question: When entering or crossing a road from a driveway:
choices: Pass the sidewalk without stopping
Yield the right-of-way to all approaching vehicles, but not to pedestrians
Stop and yield the right-of-way to all approaching vehicles and pedestrians

questions.question: When driving past this sign:
choices: Road or street ahead is for one-way traffic. Do not drive into it
Turning left at the intersection is not allowed
You are going against traffic

questions.question: When should you buckle a child with another passenger into one seat belt?
choices: Under no circumstances
When all car seats or booster seats are occupied by other children
When the child has outgrown a car seat

questions.question: Driving and a Michigan driver's license is:
choices: A constitutional right
A mandatory identification card
A privilege

questions.question: What color is the flag a flag person in a construction zone would use to direct traffic?
choices: Blue
Yellow
Red

questions.question: What shape is a regulatory speed limit sign?
choices: Rectangular
Round
Five-sided

questions.question: What does Michigan's basic speed rule mean?
choices: That you can drive 5 mph faster than posted speed limit if conditions allow
That you must always drive at a speed that is considerably less than the posted speed limit
That you may never drive at a speed that endangers you or anyone else

questions.question: What should you do when approaching a bicyclist from the rear on a two-lane road?
choices: Flash your headlights
Honk your horn
Keep a safe following distance

questions.question: When parking at a railroad crossing, you must keep this distance from the nearest rail:
choices: At least 31 feet
15 feet or more
More than 50 feet

questions.question: When you see devices that warn of railroad crossings and possible oncoming trains, you should:
choices: Slow down and be ready to stop
Always stop
Keep speed and cross the tracks quickly

questions.question: When there is an oncoming car to your left and a child on a bicycle to your right on a two-way road, you should:
choices: Slow down and let the car pass before you pass
Speed up and complete the pass as quickly as possible
Keep speed and drive between the car and the child

questions.question: A large truck is driving in the middle of three lanes. If you want to pass the truck, it is best to pass:
choices: Quickly on the left
Very slowly and carefully on the left
Very quickly on the right

questions.question: When following a motorcyclist, moped rider, or bicyclist you should be aware that:
choices: They can usually stop in shorter distances than a car
Most crashes happen because they drive too slowly
They must give you the right-of-way

questions.question: You must turn on your headlights:
choices: One-half hour after sunset
During rush hours
When you come within 500 feet of an oncoming vehicle

questions.question: Which of the following statements is false about making a good right turn?
choices: Drive close to the center divider line or left edge of the road
Yield the right-of-way to pedestrians
Begin signaling well in advance

questions.question: You will typically see a warning sign with arrows in a circle pattern ahead of:
choices: A roundabout
A bridge or overpass
A work zone

questions.question: Where can you expect to see this sign?
choices: At railroad crossings
At the beginning of a no-passing zone
At the end of a no-passing zone

questions.question: When you park on a hill headed uphill, and there is a curb, you should turn your front wheels:
choices: Parallel to, and 6 to 12 inches away from the side of the road
Pointing to the side of the road
Pointing away from the side of the road

questions.question: If you must stop in a travel lane on a freeway because an emergency, you should:
choices: Stand behind your vehicle and wave traffic around
Turn on emergency hazard flashers and pull off the road when safe
Abandon your vehicle on the freeway and walk to get help

questions.question: The road edge on the right side is marked by a:
choices: Solid yellow line
Broken white line
Solid white line

questions.question: The best way to drive through a sharp curve is:
choices: To slow down when you have entered the curve
Not to change your speed
To slow down before entering the curve

questions.question: Driving under the influence of a prescription drug that impairs your driving is allowed:
choices: If prescribed by your physician
If you do not use freeways
Under no circumstances

questions.question: What should you do when you approach this sign?
choices: Pull over and stop
Turn around and find an alternate route
Slow down and be ready to stop ahead

questions.question: You are following a large commercial vehicle. It approaches an intersection and signals left but moves out to the right. What is the best thing to do?
choices: Stay well back and give it room
Pass quickly as it starts to slow down
Assume the signal is wrong and it is really turning right

questions.question: Always allow extra room in front of your vehicle when following:
choices: A police car
A passenger car
A motorcycle

questions.question: You must obey signals and directions from school crossing guards:
choices: Only during school hours
At all times
Only when you see children close by

questions.question: To avoid getting tired on a long trip, you should:
choices: Turn off radio and avoid other irregular sounds
Keep your eyes focused on the road ahead
Roll down your window, and get some fresh air

questions.question: You approach a railroad crossing. There is heavy traffic ahead. You must stop before the crossing when:
choices: The crossing is not controlled by gates, signals, or a flagman
You transport children in a passenger vehicle
You do not have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks

questions.question: A car passenger older than 16 must use a safety belt:
choices: When riding in the back seat
When riding in either front seat or back seat
When riding in the front seat

questions.question: You should adjust your seat and mirrors:
choices: Before you start the engine and drive away
After you start driving
Before you get into your vehicle

questions.question: When you exit a roundabout, you should:
choices: Make sure you pass other vehicles on the outside
Slow down and stop if necessary
Use your turn signals

questions.question: When should you use your horn?
choices: To alert another driver who might turn in front of you and cause an accident
When passing a bicycle and there is not enough room to change lane
To alert a driver that signals a change of lane in front of you

questions.question: From top to bottom, the following is the proper order for traffic lights:
choices: Yellow, green, red
Green, yellow, red
Red, yellow, green

questions.question: Flashing or oscillating green lights on a vehicle on the highway indicate:
choices: Ongoing road work
That it is safe to pass
Clear road ahead

questions.question: Signs that warn you of possible dangers ahead are:
choices: Yellow
Brown
Red

questions.question: When driving at night, be sure that you can stop:
choices: Within 500 feet
Within 5-10 seconds
Within the distance you can see ahead

questions.question: Which of these statements about motorcycles is true?
choices: Drivers should move into the same lane alongside a motorcycle
Motorcycles should be followed at a greater distance
Motorcycles are small and can be easily seen by drivers

questions.question: You meet a school bus with flashing red lights. It is stopped on the other side of a four-lane roadway with median separation. What should you do?
choices: Look for children and pass carefully
Stop only if the bus has stopped in a loading zone
Always stop

questions.question: You are driving in the left lane when see this sign. What should you do?
choices: Merge right
Allow other vehicles to merge smoothly
Increase speed and keep position

questions.question: Where should children ages 12 and younger be placed in vehicles equipped with airbags?
choices: In either front seat or back seat, it doesn't matter
In the back seat
In the front seat

questions.question: This sign tells you that the center lane is used for:
choices: Left turns only
Passing slow traffic
Right turns only

questions.question: When stopping before a left turn, you should turn your front tires:
choices: To the left
To the right
Straight ahead

questions.question: You see this sign on a vehicle ahead. What does it mean?
choices: The vehicle is carrying a load that is potentially dangerous
The vehicle is moving slower than normal traffic
The vehicle is wider than normal

questions.question: When you enter a freeway off-ramp that curves downhill, you should:
choices: Never drive slower than the posted speed limit for the freeway
Start braking after entering the curve
Slow to a safe speed before the curve

questions.question: Where will you find a sign with this shape?
choices: Where a highway ends
At railroad crossings
Where entering is prohibited

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: Pedestrian crossing ahead
School or school crossing
Cross road

questions.question: What should you do if you approach a stopped police vehicle with activated emergency lights on a multi-lane roadway?
choices: Keep your speed and avoid stopping
Slow down and move over a lane if possible
Turn on your headlights

questions.question: When two vehicles from different directions arrive at the same time at a four-way stop:
choices: The vehicle on the right goes first
The vehicle on the right goes first, unless the vehicle on the left is bigger
The vehicle on the right must yield

questions.question: When being passed by another vehicle, you should:
choices: Keep your speed
Honk your horn
Keep as far left as possible

questions.question: When parking uphill on a two-way street with no curbs, your front wheels should be:
choices: Turned to the left (toward the street)
Turned to the right (away from the street)
Parallel with the street

questions.question: What is the best advice for a driver who has been drinking alcohol?
choices: To drink water
To ask somebody who has not been drinking to drive
To drink black coffee
